marklogic.body:
Depends where you want to go with this doesn't it.
No doubt in the Heat of the moment a footballer may have called another footballer a B-ack Bastard, do you make this into a racist police investigation? Totally ridiculous.
Let's go one step farther and you make it a racist offence to use the word Black in any kind of altercation on the pitch ie a black player has deliberately hacked me down and could have easily broken my leg. I turn round and call him a Black B and get arrested even though a deliberate assault has been carried out on me. Does this make me a racist? Do I now have the right to sue the other footballer for a racist attack?Â
Or take the same situation and instead of calling him a Black B I use the words "You thick lipped bastard". Do I get arrested for racial abuse? The point is this leads us down a very difficult road and it is impossible to legislate against. That is why Blatter is right for a change.
